definition: to become exhilarated (idiom); in high spirits/full of zest

sentences.english: To the great vitality in the face of any challenge.
sentences.chinese: 以勃勃的生机面对任何的挑战。

sentences.english: He muckraked his political rivals with great relish.
sentences.chinese: 他兴致勃勃地揭发政敌的贪污腐化。

sentences.english: Jenna was always happy and bubbly, a lovely person.
sentences.chinese: 珍娜总是很高兴，生气勃勃的，是一个可爱的人。

sentences.english: They ventured on an ambitious program of reform.
sentences.chinese: 他们冒然采取一项野心勃勃的改革计画。

sentences.english: The flowers and hanging baskets were breathtaking.
sentences.chinese: 花朵和吊篮生机勃勃的长着。

sentences.english: it will be the time for China to demonstrate to the world the demeanor of its dramatic and dynamic new image.
sentences.chinese: 是中国展示它引人注目的和生机勃勃的新形象的时候。

sentences.english: His fresh enterprise is full of life and has a bright future.
sentences.chinese: 他新兴的事业生气勃勃，前途光明。

sentences.english: He's a very smart and ambitious guy.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个非常聪明且野心勃勃的家伙。

sentences.english: A bright boy left his family, going to new York to seek his fortune.
sentences.chinese: 一个生机勃勃的少年离开家人，到纽约去闯世界。

sentences.english: This is an ambitious agenda: But can it be done?
sentences.chinese: 这是一项雄心勃勃的议程，但它是否能够实现呢？

sentences.english: Our school is elegant and full of vitality.
sentences.chinese: 我们让优雅的校园，充满勃勃生机。

sentences.english: China's most ambitious undertaking is a new deep-sea port for oil tankers.
sentences.chinese: 中国最野心勃勃的事业是一个新建的油轮深海港口。

sentences.english: Vibrant small- and medium-sized enterprises are key engines of economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 生气勃勃的中小型企业是经济增长的主要动力。

sentences.english: Not only are the user groups and conferences lively.
sentences.chinese: 用户组和相关会议都开展得生气勃勃。

sentences.english: A lot of people start gardens and give up when the going gets tough.
sentences.chinese: 很多人兴致勃勃地开始种菜，但出现困难后就放弃了。

definition: to sprout up/to flourish/(of war etc) to break out/rapid growth
opportunity to live/to reprieve from death/life force/vitality
see 生機盎然|生机盎然[sheng1 yi4 ang4 ran2]
full of youthful energy (idiom); vigorous/energetic/a bright spark
to rouse to vigorous action/energetic mood
